intro: Phyllospadix juzepczukii, commonly known as the coastal sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific coast of North America. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spade-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, showy blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along tidal zones and is often found in coastal dunes. Phyllospadix juzepczukii is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate periodic flooding, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
